subject: Attention Mr Sheldon / (official1779012@gmail.com)
body:
Attention Mr Sheldon

Thanks  for your mail received this morning.The investor name is Mr RAFAEL
SAVIMBI JR.he is from Angola republic and also a former leader.During his
tenure,he awarded a contract to two  business oil mugol from the kingdom of
saudi arabia and a brunei business man.although there was an over invoice
and gratification that made up this investment funds $1.5BILLION.

However,as I send this mail,Mr Rafael Savimbi Jr,is politically exposed,and
does want any one to know he is involved in this project,that is the reason
he will want you to have full and sole control of this investment for the
period of TEN 10years.

As you can see,Mr RAFAEL SAVIMBI JR,just mentioned all these projects or
industries,but it all depends on you to know and choose areas that will be
profitable where you can invest the funds judiciously and make profit.You
can invest these funds in any business of your choice.

The sharing ratio is as follows.
65% of the total is for the investor Mr RAFAEL SAVIMBI JR
34% of the total amount is for MR SHELDON AND GROUP
1% will be set aside to defray any expenses that we might in incure in the
process of payment,and shall be reimbursed back as soon as the funds gets
into your custody.it will be captured in the Mou/agreement which i will
send to you soonest which will be legalized in your present before
proceeding to the Absa bank for payment face to face in your present also.

Lastly, I would like to have all your details,to enable me to send you
Mou/agreement to let you know where the funds were deposited.

If there are any more questions,please feel free to ask.

Please for further correspondences to this email address   (
official1779012@gmail.com)


Await your urgent return mail.

Mr Steven James
a consultant  to Mr Rafael Savimbi Jnr.

subject: Attention Mr Sheldon
body:

subject: Re: Attention Mr Sheldon
body:
Hello Mr. Steven James,

I hope this message finds you well. Yes, I did receive your email. How can I assist you? Please provide me with more details about the matter at hand.

Looking forward to your prompt response.

Best wishes,
Sheldon

subject: Re: Attention Mr Sheldon / (official1779012@gmail.com)
body:
Dear Mr. Steven James,

Thank you for reaching out to me and providing this information about Mr. Rafael Savimbi Jr. It sounds like he has an interesting investment opportunity. I would like to learn more about the projects he mentioned and how I can potentially be involved.

Could you please provide some additional details about the specific businesses or industries that Mr. Savimbi is looking to invest in? Also, what is the estimated timeframe for this investment?

I appreciate your willingness to share the sharing ratio, but could you clarify what "MR SHELDON AND GROUP" refers to? Is it a group of investors or individuals?

Furthermore, I would like to understand the process of how the funds will be transferred and what steps need to be taken on my end. Can you explain more about the Mou agreement and its purpose?

Lastly, could you please provide some background information on where the funds are currently deposited? It would help me gain a better understanding of the situation.

Thank you again for your email, and I look forward to your prompt response.

Best wishes,
Sheldon

subject: Re: Attention Mr Sheldon / (official1779012@gmail.com)
body:
Attention Mr Sheldon

Thank you very for your kind mail.Yes he mentions so many investment
opportunities there in but the onus lies in you the potential investment
manager/potential beneficiary.what  i mean is this,is MR SHELDON will know
from all the mentioned investment the areas the ones that will be suitable
for you to invest the funds.So you have the right to chose any business you
 will wish to invest the funds  the moment it is transferred into your
custoday.so it  is never mandatory you must invest the funds on the atlines
businesses.

Mr Savimbi is not looking at any particular business  to invest the funds.it
 is now left for you to decide on any areas you wish to invest the
funds,what really matters here  is the good annual return,because Mr
Rafael's share you still invest it for him,i mean his share of 65%,there
the profit will share 50/50 annually.

The estimate time frame depends on your ability to meet with the
amalgamated bank of south africa (ABSA) with the full help of a financial
expert Mr Jose Amash who will take you through the offices and desk to desk
in the bank for signing of payment documents,but  that would  be after the
face to face legalization of the Mou/agreement in the court which will
stand as a binding bond between you and the investor Mr Rafael Savimbi jr.
So between now and 10th of march 2024,I think we should be able to finalize
everything about the transfer into your account.

No i do not mean it must  be a group,but if it is a group or individual no
problems.if you will handle  the whole thing alone fine,but if you are a
company or a group still not bad.

Yes I will send you the Mou/agreement to study, sign and return back. the
Mou/agreement will be legalized in the court in the present of the parties
concerned and after that we proceed to the bank for payment.Your role,you
are the investment manager/potential beneficiary of the
funds/investment.you will take absolute charge and take a sole control of
the business for the period of 10years.You  will be coming to south africa
to sign the payment release order with help of the financial expert like i
told you.bear in mind the funds was deposited in escrow suspense agreement
account with the ABSA.

SO please send your details to me to enable me forward to you our Mou.

Thanks for your understanding.

Await your urgent return mail.

Mr Steven James
a consultant  to Mr Rafael Savimbi Jnr.

subject: Re: Attention Mr Sheldon / (official1779012@gmail.com)
body:
Dear Mr. Steven James,

Thank you for reaching out to me and providing all this information about potential investments. I appreciate your assistance in helping me make the right decision. I understand that it is my choice to decide which business to invest in, and I will take some time to carefully consider all the options.

Could you please provide more details about the estimated time frame for finalizing everything? It would be helpful to know how long the process might take.

Also, could you explain a bit more about the Mou agreement and its significance? I want to make sure I fully understand the legal aspects before proceeding.

Lastly, could you clarify if there are any specific requirements or qualifications needed for handling the whole investment process alone as an individual?

I look forward to receiving the Mou agreement and studying it thoroughly. Once I have reviewed it, I will promptly sign and return it as requested.

Thank you again for your assistance.

Best wishes,
Sheldon

subject: Re: Attention Mr Sheldon / (official1779012@gmail.com)
body:
Hello Mr. Steven James,

Thank you for reaching out to me again. I appreciate the opportunity to learn more about this investment opportunity. It sounds like a unique arrangement with Mr. Rafael Savimbi as the silent investor and myself as the active investment manager.

I understand that Mr. Savimbi prefers to keep this investment confidential, which is why he has chosen me for this role. I'm curious, what made him select me specifically? Is there something about my background or experience that caught his attention?

You mentioned that I would need to travel to South Africa to meet with the financial expert, Mr. Jose Ash. Could you provide more details about his expertise and how he will assist in ensuring a smooth transfer of funds? Additionally, what kind of documents will be involved in this process?

Regarding the timeline, you mentioned that it would be ideal if everything could be concluded by the end of February so that I can start investing in March. Is there any flexibility in this timeline? I want to make sure I can meet all the necessary requirements before committing fully.

Lastly, you mentioned a fee for expenses in court related to the MOU (Memorandum of Understanding). Could you please provide more information on what these expenses entail and how they are calculated?

Thank you once again for your assistance and guidance throughout this process. I look forward to receiving your response.

Best wishes,
Sheldon
